Description: Green and white glass spindle whorl or bead; rod-formed; domical shape with a flat base; made from green glass trailed with white, the feathered; damage (or wear) to the edges of the perforation.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus (probably)
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 125, Tomb 244)
